    Run collider bias analysis

    analyse.Rd

    Run all the analyses defined in the ColliderBias object x with all combinations of the listed parameters. Be careful with large numbers of parameters as this will quickly lead to very large numbers of combinations. e.g.

    • methods = c("slopehunter")

    • ip = c(0.05,0.001,0.00001)

    • pi0 = c(0.6, 0.65, 0.7)

    • sxy1 = c(1e-5, 1e-4, 1e-3)

    ...will lead to 27 separate analyses. 

    analyse(x, methods, ip, pi0, sxy1, bootstraps)

# S3 method for ColliderBias
analyse(
  x,
  methods = NULL,
  ip = NULL,
  pi0 = NULL,
  sxy1 = NULL,
  bootstraps = NULL
)

    Arguments

    x

    a ColliderBias object

    methods

    a character vector, one or more valid collider bias analysis methods slopehunter, dudbridge, ivw_mr

    ip

    a numeric, range 0-1, the initial p-value by which to filter the incidence GWAS

    pi0

    a numeric, range 0-1, the initial weight / percentage of SNPs that affect incidence only

    sxy1

    a numeric, the initial (guess) of the covariance between incidence and progression BETAs

    bootstraps

    a whole-number numeric, the number of bootstrap samples to estimate the SE of the adjustment factor (can be zero)

    Value

    a ColliderBias object with updated parameter and results fields

    Contents

    Developed by Nicholas Sunderland, Andrew Elmore.
